comments:
I am unable to use debug.
This is my java runtime:
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0-b64)

The following is the log when I try to debug a java program:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.debug.ui 4 5012 2005-07-18 11:16:25.410
!MESSAGE Exceptions occurred attempting to step over the frame
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.jdt.debug 4 5010 2005-07-18 11:16:25.410
!MESSAGE org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for 
packet 977. occurred creating step request.
!STACK 0
org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet

st(JDIThread.java:1757)

ob.run(AbstractDebugActionDelegate.java:150)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:76)

This is likely a dup of bug 94452. Questions:

* what sort of hardware are you using?
* when does the problem occurr (are you showing lots of variables/logical 
structures, etc)?
* if you increase the communication timeout setting in the "Java > Debug" 
preferences, does the problem go away? (say from 3000ms to 5000ms).

As a workaround, you could try the replacement plug-in patch on bug 94452 (3rd 
attachment to the bug).

Sorry for the delay in replying.

My hardware: P4 2.66GHz, 512MB RAM
Problem occurs irrepective of whether I am showing a list of variables or not.
I still get the exception even after increasing communication timeout setting.
I unzipped the attachment from bug 94452 into eclipse directory after removing 
the old org.eclipse.jdt.debug_3.1.0 directory in plugin folder and started 
eclipse. The problem continues to occur even after that. 

Please let me know if you need any further info.

(In reply to comment #1)

> attachment to the bug).

What VM/version are you using to debug your application? can you attach a 
sample program that causes the exception?

(In reply to comment #3)
> What VM/version are you using to debug your application? can you attach a 
> sample program that causes the exception?

I have an update on this...

I am building an application targeting WAS 3.5 and so am using the following 
java version:
java version "1.2.2"
Classic VM (J2RE 1.2.2 IBM build wn122-20000720 (JIT enabled: jitc))

When using this I am getting the problem.

When I move to the following version, everything is working:
java version "1.5.0"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0-b64)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0-b64, mixed mode, sharing)

But, I need to debug with IBM java 1.2.2. How do I do that?

thanks.

VM versions 1.2.x do not have JDWP support required for debugging. You can 
copy jdwp.dll and jdwp_g.dll from the bin directory of a 1.3.1 VM to a 1.2.2 
install and hope that debugging works. This worked for me using a Sun VM - not 
sure if it works with IBM VMs. Debugging on 1.2.x is not officially supported 
by Eclipse.

traces.message: Timeout occurred while waiting for packet  977.
